name: New Zealand Research Information System (NZRIS) Data Specifications Person Career Stage
maintainer: Ministry of Business, Innovation and Employment

Definition: A First Stage Researcher conducts research under supervision. This may include PhD and research masters students

An Emerging Researcher has made a contribution through original research by developing a substantial body of work, innovation or application which may merit national or internationally refereed publications, patents, and papers at conferences and congresses

An Established Researcher identifies research problems and opportunities within their area of expertise, conducts research independently which advances a research agenda, can form research consortia, and secure research funding/budgets from funding agencies or industry, publishes papers as lead author, acts as a mentor for other researchers

A Leading Researcher has an international reputation based on research excellence in their field and a proven record of securing significant research funding.  This researcher is a professional development role model for others. They focus on long term team planning and career paths for researchers, securing funding for team positions
